Articles.Content:
I'm under the impression that if guiActiveEditor in a field is set to false then it doesn't display in the SPH or VAB.  Am I incorrect in this assumption?  This code below shows the buttons in the SPH/VAB and I don't want it to. 

        [KSPField(isPersistant = false, guiActive = true, guiActiveEditor = false, guiName = "Depressureizer"),
            UI_Toggle(disabledText = "Off", enabledText = "On")]
        public bool depressurizerActive = false;

I've always thought guiActiveEditor = false would keep the menu item from displaying in the editor - might it be coming from the UI_Toggle? There's a UI_Toggle(scene = UI_Scene.All/Editor/Flight/None) - might do the trick.

guiActive = false, guiActiveEditor = false does disable everything in the editor, but scene flags ( UI_Scene.Flight as above ) probably work better. You can have different editor & flight UI controls.

Field["depressurizerActive"].uiControlEditor = null later on might also work, no idea how terrible an idea that is internally

Edited September 20, 2016 by Van Disaster
